title: Isthmus of Catalina Island
text: The Isthmus of Catalina Island is a 770-meter (842 yards) section of land that joins the northwestern portion of <a href="Santa%20Catalina%20Island%2C%20California">Santa Catalina Island</a> to the main part of the island. It lies approximately southwest of <a href="San%20Pedro%20Harbor">San Pedro Harbor</a>. Part of the <a href="isthmus">isthmus</a> is occupied by the town of <a href="Two%20Harbors%2C%20California">Two Harbors</a>, named for two harbors on either side of the isthmus, Isthmus Cove and Catalina Harbor. Two Harbors lies on the <a href="Windward%20and%20leeward">leeward</a> side facing Isthmus Cove. The northern part of Santa Catalina contains about one sixth (31.7 km²) of the entire island's land mass.
